Name: Compute Platform Message Registry
Description: This registry defines messages for compute platforms, covering topics related to processor, memory, and I/O device connectivity.

UnhandledExceptionDetectedAfterReset.Description: Indicates that an unhandled exception caused the platform to reset.
UnhandledExceptionDetectedAfterReset.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that an unhandled exception caused a compute platform to reset.  The exception was detected after the reset occurred.
UnhandledExceptionDetectedAfterReset.Message: An unhandled exception caused a platform reset.
UnhandledExceptionDetectedAfterReset.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

OperatingSystemCrash.Description: Indicates the operating system was halted due to a catastrophic error.
OperatingSystemCrash.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that an unhandled exception caused a compute platform to crash or otherwise halt.
OperatingSystemCrash.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

PlatformError.Description: Indicates that a platform error occurred.
PlatformError.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a platform error occurred.
PlatformError.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

PlatformErrorAtLocation.Description: Indicates that a platform error occurred and device or other location information is available.
PlatformErrorAtLocation.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a platform error occurred with specific device identification information available.
PlatformErrorAtLocation.Message: A platform error occurred at location '%1'.
ArgDescriptions: The device description or location where the error occurred.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a description of the device or location where the error occurred.
PlatformErrorAtLocation.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

NVRAMClearAsserted.Description: Indicates that the 'NVRAM Clear' jumper or switch is currently asserted.
NVRAMClearAsserted.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that the 'NVRAM Clear' jumper or switch is currently asserted.
NVRAMClearAsserted.Resolution: Turn off the 'NVRAM Clear' jumper or switch.

SecurityBypassAsserted.Description: Indicates that the 'Security Bypass' jumper or switch is currently asserted.
SecurityBypassAsserted.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that the 'Security Bypass' or 'Password Bypass' jumper or switch is currently asserted.
SecurityBypassAsserted.Resolution: Turn off the 'Security Bypass' jumper or switch.

PlatformReset.Description: Indicates that the platform reset occurred.
PlatformReset.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a platform reset occurred.
PlatformReset.Message: A platform performed a '%1' type of reset.
ArgDescriptions: The type of reset that occurred.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the type of reset that occurred.  This argument shall contain one of the values of the `ResetType` enumeration from the `Resource` schema.

PlatformResetWatchdogTimer.Description: Indicates that the platform reset occurred due to a watchdog timer action.
PlatformResetWatchdogTimer.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a platform reset occurred due to a watchdog timer action.
PlatformResetWatchdogTimer.Message: A platform performed a '%1' type of reset due to watchdog timer action.
ArgDescriptions: The type of reset that occurred.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain the type of reset that occurred.  This argument shall contain one of the values of the `ResetType` enumeration from the `Resource` schema.
PlatformResetWatchdogTimer.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

PowerBrake.Description: Indicates that a power brake is applied to a component or equipment.
PowerBrake.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a power brake is applied to a component or equipment.
PowerBrake.Message: A power brake is applied to '%1'.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the component or equipment.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the component or equipment.
PowerBrake.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

VoltageRegulatorFault.Description: Indicates that a voltage regulator has faulted.
VoltageRegulatorFault.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a voltage regulator has faulted.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the voltage regulator.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the voltage regulator.
VoltageRegulatorFault.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

MemoryRowRemappingError.Description: Indicates that a memory device encountered a row remapping failure.
MemoryRowRemappingError.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a memory device encountered a row remapping failure.
MemoryRowRemappingError.Message: Memory device '%1' encountered a row remapping failure.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the memory device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `Memory` resource.
MemoryRowRemappingError.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

MemoryRowRemappingPending.Description: Indicates that row remapping is pending for a memory device.
MemoryRowRemappingPending.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that row remapping is pending for a memory device.
MemoryRowRemappingPending.Message: Row remapping is pending for memory device '%1'.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the memory device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `Memory` resource.
MemoryRowRemappingPending.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

MemoryUncorrectableError.Description: Indicates that a memory device detected an uncorrectable error and the error was not contained.
MemoryUncorrectableError.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a memory device detected an uncorrectable error and the error was not contained.
MemoryUncorrectableError.Message: Memory device '%1' detected an uncorrectable error.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the memory device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `Memory` resource.
MemoryUncorrectableError.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

MemoryContainedError.Description: Indicates that a memory device detected an uncorrectable error, but contained it.
MemoryContainedError.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a memory device detected an uncorrectable error, but contained it.
MemoryContainedError.Message: Memory device '%1' contained an uncorrectable error.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the memory device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `Memory` resource.
MemoryContainedError.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

PCIeLinkSpeedChange.Description: Indicates that a PCIe link speed changed at runtime.
PCIeLinkSpeedChange.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a PCIe link speed changed at runtime.
PCIeLinkSpeedChange.Message: PCIe device '%1' detected a runtime speed change to %2 Gbps.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the PCIe device.
The new link speed (Gbps).
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `PCIeDevice` resource.
This argument shall contain the new link speed (Gbps).
PCIeLinkSpeedChange.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

PCIeLinkWidthChange.Description: Indicates that a PCIe link width changed at runtime.
PCIeLinkWidthChange.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a PCIe link width changed at runtime.
PCIeLinkWidthChange.Message: PCIe device '%1' detected a runtime speed change to %2 Gbps.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the PCIe device.
The new link width.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `PCIeDevice` resource.
This argument shall contain the new link width.
PCIeLinkWidthChange.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

PCIeLinkTrainingError.Description: Indicates that a PCIe device could not establish a link with the upstream interface.
PCIeLinkTrainingError.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a PCIe device could not establish a link with the upstream interface.
PCIeLinkTrainingError.Message: PCIe device '%1' could not train its link.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the PCIe device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `PCIeDevice` resource.
PCIeLinkTrainingError.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

PCIeLinkDown.Description: Indicates that a PCIe device lost its link with the upstream interface.
PCIeLinkDown.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a PCIe device lost its link with the upstream interface.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the PCIe device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `PCIeDevice` resource.
PCIeLinkDown.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

PCIeIncorrectLinkSpeed.Description: Indicates that a PCIe device did not train to its expected link speed.
PCIeIncorrectLinkSpeed.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a PCIe device did not train to its expected link speed.
PCIeIncorrectLinkSpeed.Message: PCIe device '%1' did not train to its expected link speed.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the PCIe device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `PCIeDevice` resource.
PCIeIncorrectLinkSpeed.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

PCIeIncorrectLinkWidth.Description: Indicates that a PCIe device did not train to its expected link width.
PCIeIncorrectLinkWidth.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a PCIe device did not train to its expected link width.
PCIeIncorrectLinkWidth.Message: PCIe device '%1' did not train to its expected link width.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the PCIe device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `PCIeDevice` resource.
PCIeIncorrectLinkWidth.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

PCIeUncorrectableError.Description: Indicates that a PCIe device detected an uncorrectable error.
PCIeUncorrectableError.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a PCIe device detected an uncorrectable error.
PCIeUncorrectableError.Message: PCIe device '%1' detected an uncorrectable error.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the PCIe device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `PCIeDevice` resource.
PCIeUncorrectableError.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

PCIeLinkRestored.Description: Indicates that a PCIe device restored its link with the upstream interface.
PCIeLinkRestored.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a PCIe device restored its link with the upstream interface.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the PCIe device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes the `PCIeDevice` resource.
PCIeLinkRestored.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.  Check the platform and connectors for any faults.

DeviceDisabled.Description: Indicates that a device was disabled or halted.
DeviceDisabled.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a device was disabled or halted.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
DeviceDisabled.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceManagementInterfaceUnresponsive.Description: Indicates that the management interface for a device is unresponsive.
DeviceManagementInterfaceUnresponsive.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that the management interface for a device is unresponsive.
DeviceManagementInterfaceUnresponsive.Message: The management interface for device '%1' is unresponsive.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
DeviceManagementInterfaceUnresponsive.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceMissing.Description: Indicates that the device has asserted Device Missing
DeviceMissing.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate the device has asserted Device Missing
DeviceMissing.Message: The Device %1 state changed to  absent.
ArgDescriptions: Indicates the device component Id that asserted this message
ArgLongDescriptions: The argument shall contain the device component Id that asserted this message
DeviceMissing.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceAssemblyDataInaccessible.Description: Indicates that the assembly data, historically 'FRU data', for a device is inaccessible.
DeviceAssemblyDataInaccessible.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that the assembly data for a device is inaccessible.
DeviceAssemblyDataInaccessible.Message: Unable to access the assembly data for device '%1'.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
DeviceAssemblyDataInaccessible.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceAssemblyDataMalformed.Description: Indicates that the assembly data, historically 'FRU data', for a device is malformed, such as due to a checksum error.
DeviceAssemblyDataMalformed.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that the assembly data for a device is malformed, such as due to a checksum error.
DeviceAssemblyDataMalformed.Message: Malformed assembly data detected for device '%1'.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
DeviceAssemblyDataMalformed.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceWatchdogTimeout.Description: Indicates that a device encountered a watchdog timeout.
DeviceWatchdogTimeout.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a device encountered a watchdog timeout.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
DeviceWatchdogTimeout.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceBootTimeout.Description: Indicates that a device encountered a boot timeout.
DeviceBootTimeout.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a device encountered a boot timeout.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
DeviceBootTimeout.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceSecureBootFailure.Description: Indicates that a device encountered a secure boot failure.
DeviceSecureBootFailure.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a device encountered a secure boot failure.
DeviceSecureBootFailure.Message: Device '%1' encountered a secure boot failure.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
DeviceSecureBootFailure.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceInRecovery.Description: Indicates that a device is not operating properly and entered recovery mode to restore firmware or critical data to a state of integrity.
DeviceInRecovery.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that a device is not operating properly and entered recovery mode, such as defined by the OCP Secure Firmware Recovery specification, to restore firmware or critical data to a state of integrity.
DeviceInRecovery.Message: Device '%1' entered recovery mode due to: %2.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
The reason the device entered recovery mode.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
This argument shall contain a string that describes the reason the device entered recovery mode.
DeviceInRecovery.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.

DeviceManagementInterfaceError.Description: Indicates that the management interface for a device encountered an error.
DeviceManagementInterfaceError.LongDescription: This message shall indicate that the management interface for a device encountered an error.
DeviceManagementInterfaceError.Message: The management interface for device '%1' encountered the error: %2.
ArgDescriptions: The name or identifier of the device.
The error encountered on the management interface of the device.
ArgLongDescriptions: This argument shall contain a string that identifies or describes device.
This argument shall contain a string that describes error encountered on the management interface of the device.
DeviceManagementInterfaceError.Resolution: Check additional diagnostic data if available.
